patch.description: Modifies account or Accounts with given id(s)

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: ID of account to update

parameters.name: validation-level
parameters.description:
Specify validation level of account on update. Use them as bit mask: 0 - validate each field on entity,
2 - validate only changed fields, 4 - validate only system fields, 8 - allows to override readonly fields,
16 - allows to set entity on deleted relationship.

requestBody.description: id(s) of modified item(s) and fields to modify

success.description: True when response succeeded, false on error.

404.description: Sent when invalid ID is given

parameters.name: include-deleted
parameters.description: if enabled, deleted Accounts are returned as well

parameters.name: first
parameters.description: Number of entities to return from beginning of the result set. Max: 100. Default: 30

parameters.name: last
parameters.description: Return only the "last" number of entities from result set. When used with first parameter, then it returns last M records from the first N records.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Cursor until which to take entities to result set.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Cursor after which to start taking entities to result set.

parameters.name: expand
parameters.description: Expand related entity. Use api_names of relation fields. You can use multiple values separated via ',' colon. If not used, URI link will be returned instead. You can use dots '.' to expand nested entities as well.

parameters.name: order-by
parameters.description: Order by values. Use api_name of field to sort by ascending. Prefix api_name with '-' to descending sort. You can use multiple values separated via ',' colon.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Use name of field in braces to filter by this field. To advanced filter, use with combination with filter-op parameter.

parameters.name: filter-op
parameters.description: Filter operator. Specify a way how to filter fields. Supported operators: [eq, ieq, not-eq, not-ieq, contains, starts, ends, icontains, istarts, iends, null, not-null, empty, not-empty, gt, gte, lt, lte, between].

parameters.name: load-only
parameters.description: Loads only fields defined within this parameter. You can use multiple values separated via ',' colon. If not used, then all fields are returned. You can use dots '.' to specify load only fields in nested as well.

success.description: True when response succeeded, false on error.

has_previous_page.description: If result set has previous page (if yes, use start_cursor value in before parameter to load it).

has_next_page.description: If result set has next page (if yes, use end_cursor value in after parameter to load it).

page_info.description: Page info result set. Please note it is returned only when legacy limit & offset parameters are not used.

parameters.description: Order by values. Use api_name of field to sort by ascending. Prefix api_name with '-' to descending sort. You can use multiple values separated via ',' colon.

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Use name of field in braces to filter by this field. To advanced filter, use with combination with filter-op parameter.

parameters.name: filter-op
parameters.description: Filter operator. Specify a way how to filter fields. Supported operators: [eq, ieq, not-eq, not-ieq, contains, starts, ends, icontains, istarts, iends, null, not-null, empty, not-empty, gt, gte, lt, lte, between].

success.description: True when response succeeded, false on error.

has_next_page.description: If result set has next page (if yes, use end_cursor value in after parameter to load it).
